DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study determine whether craniosacral therapy program effective disability , quality life , autonomic nervous system oxidative stress indicator patient chronic low back pain .
DOC.brief_title: Craniosacral Therapy Treat Chronic Low Back Pain
DOC.detailed_description: Design : Randomized clinical trial . Objective : determine effectiveness craniosacral therapy program disability , quality life , autonomic nervous system , body mass , hormonal indicator , spinal projection , oxidative stress indicator patient chronic low back pain . Participants : Seventy patient chronic non-specific low back pain randomly assign experimental control group . Intervention : For 10-week , experimental group undergo treatment comprise 10 session ( 1/week ) craniosacral therapy program ten technique , control group receive one craniosacral technique . Main Outcome Measures : disability , quality life , biochemical estimation interstitial fluid , body mass indicator , hormonal indicator , indicator autonomic nervous system , indicator oxidative stress collect group baseline , 10 week 15 week last intervention experimental control group , assessor blind treatment allocation patient . Baseline demographic clinical variable examine group independent Student t-test continuous data . Separate 2x3 model ANOVA time ( baseline , 10 week 15 week ) within-subjects factor , group ( experimental , control ) determine effect treatment .
DOC.criteria: Low back pain > 3 month Score > 4 Roland Morris Disability questionnaire No undergo another physical therapy treatment Clinical sign radiculopathy Presence lumbar stenosis Fibromyalgia Spondylolisthesis History spinal surgery Treatment corticosteroid past two week Disease central peripheral nervous system
